title: Tips for speedy leaf mould and how to deadhead roses, by garden expert Helen Yemm
text:
Every week, Telegraph gardening expert Helen Yemm gives tips and advice on all your gardening problems whether at home or on the allotment. If you have a question, see below for how to contact her.

Speedy leaf composting

Last year’s leaves, stored in a wire cage as recommended, have not composted evenly. Those at the edges have still barely rotted. Should I have stirred them up? Is there a knack to speeding up the process next year?

Martin Phipps – via email

Stir the dry leaves into the rest of the half-made leaf mould in your old cage and try to find a place in your garden for a second cage for this year’s leaves. If you have space to tuck it away somewhere invisible, a recycled builders’...
description: Every week, Telegraph gardening expert Helen Yemm gives tips and advice on all your gardening problems whether at home or on the allotment.
